pr_title: Allow to use empty payloads with the TTN provider

timeline.message: Allow to use empty payloads with the TTN provider

timeline.bodyText: so far we have defined this content type for events only. However, the adapter sends all downstream messages using the Telemetry API ...
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: True. However, currently there is way for the LoRaWAN adapter to send events. And, given the fact that LoRaWAN is very conservative what is being sent, I would say that transmissions might be more important, and maybe more events rather then telemetry. In any case, at the moment, a LoRaWAN device doesn't have the ability to send an empty payload. As it is a valid operation on the TTN provider side, I think it should be a valid operation in Hono as well.
replies.author: ctron

replies.bodyText:
However, currently there is way for the LoRaWAN adapter to send events. And, given the fact that LoRaWAN is very conservative what is being sent, I would say that transmissions might be more important, and maybe more events rather then telemetry.

Not sure if I am following. Are you suggesting to let the Lora adapter send events instead of telemetry messages downstream? I am open to the idea. We might also be able to use the ACK flag of uplink messages to determine whether data should be considered an event or telemetry.

In any case, at the moment, a LoRaWAN device doesn't have the ability to send an empty payload.

You mean because the Lora adapter doesn't support this?

As it is a valid operation on the TTN provider side, I think it should be a valid operation in Hono as well.

If that is a valid and reasonable use case for Lora devices, I agree.
replies.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
However, currently there is way for the LoRaWAN adapter to send events. And, given the fact that LoRaWAN is very conservative what is being sent, I would say that transmissions might be more important, and maybe more events rather then telemetry.

Not sure if I am following. Are you suggesting to let the Lora adapter send events instead of telemetry messages downstream? I am open to the idea. We might also be able to use the ACK flag of uplink messages to determine whether data should be considered an event or telemetry.

I simply think that at them moment, there is no way of choosing Event over Telemetry. Although Event sound like a reasonable feature in the context of LoRaWAN.


In any case, at the moment, a LoRaWAN device doesn't have the ability to send an empty payload.

You mean because the Lora adapter doesn't support this?

Exactly. I wouldn't simply switch, but as you mentioned above, find a nice way to let the user choose. Either through the URL, or a query parameter of the URL, through the LoraProvider interface, the device configuration, a part of the LoraMessage, or a mix of these options.


As it is a valid operation on the TTN provider side, I think it should be a valid operation in Hono as well.

If that is a valid and reasonable use case for Lora devices, I agree.

So I think a reasonable approach would be the finish this PR, and then start a new one, adding "Events" into the picture.
